page.title: 10Education
page.content: Newton Rigg Agricultural College. This collage was founded in 1897, but at that time was a farm school, not a college. when it first opened there were 8 full time students, now in 1985 there are 180 full time students and over 600 part time students. The courses provided in 1897 were agricultural only, but in 1985 courses are run in horticulture, agriculture, forestry machinery and land use and reclemation. During the winter the home ecomonics department run a wide variety of homecroft classes, open to anyone at a reasonable fee. The students come from the four corners of the country and form overseas. In 1985 there are students from as far as Vanatu and Fiji, and as near as 2 miles away. Each year the college runs a special course on forestry for overseas students.
